derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from pie (because of the magpie's black-and-white plumage) + bald (in the obsolete sense 'streaked with white')

entry.def: A piebald animal has patches of black and white on it.

means.word_mean: 1. having sections or patches colored differently and usually brightly;
